Player History
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 4/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Oakland on 4/3/1985 to a minor league deal...
Had first career hit (double) on 9/8/1985, off Mike Mason (TEX)...
Traded from Oakland to Los Angeles on 5/11/1986 (Going to LAD: RF Cory Snyder. Going to OAK: P Steve Howe, P Tom Brennan)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/15/1986, off Jerry Reuss (SD)...
Injured on 6/3/1986 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Hit 3 homeruns against Chicago, driving in 4 runs on 6/16/1986...
Injured on 6/22/1987 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,542,857 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/10/1988, hitting .458 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1988...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,971,429 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/17/1989, hitting .435 with 4 HR, 7 RBI...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,107,143 through salary arbitration...
9/2/1990: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $1,990,000 per year, for 3 years.
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 6/16/1991...
